intro: Saxifraga kangdingensis, commonly known as the Kangding saxifrage, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of China. It belongs to the Saxifragaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, often found in mountainous areas with cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
